result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Scott Langrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct Tremp Co Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall also pay court appointed attorney fees.  Defendant shall pay $50.00 toward fine and attorney fees on 9/15/15, balance shall be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 10/4/15 payable on the 4th of each month thereafter until paid in full.  If not paid, one day in jail for each $40.00 of unpaid fine and costs.
Court approves attorney fees of $837.00 for Case Nos.:  15 CM 73 and 12 CF 15.  Attorney fees shall be added to payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: John Sacia for the State, def appeared in person with his attorney Thomas Bilski.  Charge amended, def entered plea to amended charge, def sentenced.
Taavi McMahon for the State, def did not appear, def's attorney, Thomas Bilski, appeared in person.  PLEAS set.

Pre-trial conference at 07-27-2015 10:00 am.
Status Conference at 09-10-2015 09:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with J.S. and B.S.

Defendant Steven Scott Langrick appears by video, in custody from the Trempealeau Count.  Atty Bilski appears in person for the Def.  Taavi Mc Mahon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised defendant of  rights.  Defendant KVI waives rights and enters plea of not guilty.  Matter to be set for PTC and STC.  Bond amended.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Status Conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
